summary: This bill, H.R. 4276, amends the Native American Tourism and Improving Visitor Experience Act to authorize grants. It allows the Bureau of Indian Affairs and the Office of Native Hawaiian Relations to provide grants to Indian tribes, tribal organizations, and Native Hawaiian organizations. Other federal agencies are also authorized to award grants. The bill aims to support Native American tourism and is authorized for $35,000,000 in appropriations from fiscal years 2025-2029.
